annotations.description: Application template for an immutable KIE server in a production environment integrated with ActiveMQ, for Red Hat Process Automation Manager 7.5 - Deprecated
annotations.openshift.io/display-name: Red Hat Process Automation Manager 7.5 immutable production environment with ActiveMQ
annotations.template.openshift.io/long-description: This template defines resources needed for a immutable production runtime environment for Red Hat Process Automation Manager 7.5, including a source-to-image (S2I) build of your services, application deployment configuration, secure and insecure http communication and persistent volume to store data that needs to survive to a restart. Template for Red Hat OpenShift Container Platform version 3.11. Deprecated since Red Hat Process Automation Manager version 7.5; consider using the Red Hat Business Automation Operator.

annotations.description: All the KIE server web server's ports.
The JGroups ping port for clustering.
The broker's console and Jolokia port.
Route for KIE server's http service.
Route for KIE server's https service.

parameters.description: The name for the application.
parameters.name: APPLICATION_NAME

parameters.description: KIE administrator username.
parameters.name: KIE_ADMIN_USER

parameters.description: KIE administrator password.
parameters.name: KIE_ADMIN_PWD

parameters.description: KIE server username (Sets the org.kie.server.user system property)
parameters.name: KIE_SERVER_USER

parameters.description: KIE server password. If this parameter is not set, the password is automatically generated. (Sets the org.kie.server.pwd system property)
parameters.name: KIE_SERVER_PWD

parameters.description: Namespace in which the ImageStreams for Red Hat Process Automation Manager images are installed. These ImageStreams are normally installed in the openshift namespace. You should only need to modify this if you installed the ImageStreams in a different namespace/project.
parameters.name: IMAGE_STREAM_NAMESPACE

parameters.description: The name of the image stream to use for KIE server. Default is "rhpam-kieserver-rhel8".
parameters.name: KIE_SERVER_IMAGE_STREAM_NAME

parameters.description: A named pointer to an image in an image stream. Default is "7.5.0".
parameters.name: IMAGE_STREAM_TAG

parameters.description: KIE server persistence datasource (Sets the org.kie.server.persistence.ds system property)
parameters.name: KIE_SERVER_PERSISTENCE_DS

parameters.description: Namespace in which the ImageStream for the PostgreSQL image is installed. The ImageStream is already installed in the openshift namespace. You should only need to modify this if you installed the ImageStream in a different namespace/project. Default is "openshift".
parameters.name: POSTGRESQL_IMAGE_STREAM_NAMESPACE

parameters.description: The PostgreSQL image version, which is intended to correspond to the PostgreSQL version. Default is "10".
parameters.name: POSTGRESQL_IMAGE_STREAM_TAG

parameters.description: KIE server PostgreSQL database username
parameters.name: KIE_SERVER_POSTGRESQL_USER

parameters.description: KIE server PostgreSQL database password
parameters.name: KIE_SERVER_POSTGRESQL_PWD

parameters.description: KIE server PostgreSQL database name
parameters.name: KIE_SERVER_POSTGRESQL_DB

parameters.description: Allows the PostgreSQL to handle XA transactions.
parameters.name: POSTGRESQL_MAX_PREPARED_TRANSACTIONS

parameters.description: Size of persistent storage for the database volume.
parameters.name: DB_VOLUME_CAPACITY

parameters.description: KIE server mbeans enabled/disabled (Sets the kie.mbeans and kie.scanner.mbeans system properties)
parameters.name: KIE_MBEANS

parameters.description: KIE server class filtering (Sets the org.drools.server.filter.classes system property)
parameters.name: DROOLS_SERVER_FILTER_CLASSES

parameters.description: If set to false, the prometheus server extension will be enabled. (Sets the org.kie.prometheus.server.ext.disabled system property)
parameters.name: PROMETHEUS_SERVER_EXT_DISABLED

parameters.description: Custom hostname for http service route. Leave blank for default hostname, e.g.: insecure-<application-name>-kieserver-<project>.<default-domain-suffix>
parameters.displayName: KIE Server Custom http Route Hostname
parameters.name: KIE_SERVER_HOSTNAME_HTTP

parameters.description: Custom hostname for https service route.  Leave blank for default hostname, e.g.: <application-name>-kieserver-<project>.<default-domain-suffix>
parameters.displayName: KIE Server Custom https Route Hostname
parameters.name: KIE_SERVER_HOSTNAME_HTTPS

parameters.description: The name of the secret containing the keystore file
parameters.name: KIE_SERVER_HTTPS_SECRET

parameters.description: The name of the keystore file within the secret
parameters.name: KIE_SERVER_HTTPS_KEYSTORE

parameters.description: The name associated with the server certificate
parameters.name: KIE_SERVER_HTTPS_NAME

parameters.description: The password for the keystore and certificate
parameters.name: KIE_SERVER_HTTPS_PASSWORD

parameters.description: Allows the KIE server to bypass the authenticated user for task-related operations, for example, queries. (Sets the org.kie.server.bypass.auth.user system property)
parameters.name: KIE_SERVER_BYPASS_AUTH_USER

parameters.description: KIE Server Container deployment configuration with optional alias. Format: containerId=groupId:artifactId:version|c2(alias2)=g2:a2:v2
parameters.name: KIE_SERVER_CONTAINER_DEPLOYMENT

parameters.description: Git source URI for application
parameters.name: SOURCE_REPOSITORY_URL

parameters.description: Git branch/tag reference
parameters.name: SOURCE_REPOSITORY_REF

parameters.description: Path within Git project to build; empty for root project directory.
parameters.name: CONTEXT_DIR

parameters.description: GitHub trigger secret
parameters.name: GITHUB_WEBHOOK_SECRET

parameters.description: Generic build trigger secret
parameters.name: GENERIC_WEBHOOK_SECRET

parameters.description: Maven mirror to use for S2I builds
parameters.name: MAVEN_MIRROR_URL

parameters.description: The id to use for the maven repository, if set. Default is generated randomly.
parameters.name: MAVEN_REPO_ID

parameters.description: Fully qualified URL to a Maven repository.
parameters.name: MAVEN_REPO_URL

parameters.description: Username to access the Maven repository, if required.
parameters.name: MAVEN_REPO_USERNAME

parameters.description: Password to access the Maven repository, if required.
parameters.name: MAVEN_REPO_PASSWORD

parameters.description: The Service name for the optional Business Central, where it can be reached, to allow service lookups (for example,  maven repo usage), if required.
parameters.displayName: Name of the Business Central service
parameters.name: BUSINESS_CENTRAL_SERVICE

parameters.description: Username to access the Maven service hosted by Business Central inside EAP.
parameters.displayName: Username for the Maven service hosted by Business Central
parameters.name: BUSINESS_CENTRAL_MAVEN_USERNAME

parameters.description: Password to access the Maven service hosted by Business Central inside EAP.
parameters.displayName: Password for the Maven service hosted by Business Central
parameters.name: BUSINESS_CENTRAL_MAVEN_PASSWORD

parameters.description: List of directories from which archives will be copied into the deployment folder. If unspecified, all archives in /target will be copied.
parameters.displayName: List of directories from which archives will be copied into the deployment folder
parameters.name: ARTIFACT_DIR

parameters.description: Sets refresh-interval for the EJB timer service database-data-store.
parameters.displayName: Timer service data store refresh interval (in milliseconds)
parameters.name: TIMER_SERVICE_DATA_STORE_REFRESH_INTERVAL

parameters.description: KIE server Container memory limit
parameters.name: KIE_SERVER_MEMORY_LIMIT

parameters.description: Disable management api and don't allow KIE containers to be deployed/undeployed or started/stopped. (Sets the property org.kie.server.mgmt.api.disabled to true)
parameters.name: KIE_SERVER_MGMT_DISABLED

parameters.description: Enables the JMS executor, set false to disable it.
parameters.name: KIE_SERVER_EXECUTOR_JMS

parameters.description: Enable transactions for JMS executor, disabled by default
parameters.name: KIE_SERVER_EXECUTOR_JMS_TRANSACTED

parameters.description: JNDI name of request queue for JMS. The default value is queue/KIE.SERVER.REQUEST
parameters.name: KIE_SERVER_JMS_QUEUE_REQUEST

parameters.description: JNDI name of response queue for JMS. The default value is queue/KIE.SERVER.RESPONSE
parameters.name: KIE_SERVER_JMS_QUEUE_RESPONSE

parameters.description: JNDI name of response queue for JMS. The default value is queue/KIE.SERVER.RESPONSE
parameters.name: KIE_SERVER_JMS_QUEUE_EXECUTOR

parameters.description: JMS queue for signals
parameters.displayName: Enable KIE Server JMS Signal Queue
parameters.name: KIE_SERVER_JMS_ENABLE_SIGNAL

parameters.description: Enable the Signal configuration through JMS
parameters.name: KIE_SERVER_JMS_QUEUE_SIGNAL

parameters.description: Enable the Audit logging through JMS
parameters.name: KIE_SERVER_JMS_ENABLE_AUDIT

parameters.description: JMS queue for audit logging
parameters.name: KIE_SERVER_JMS_QUEUE_AUDIT

parameters.description: determines if JMS session is transacted or not - default true.
parameters.displayName: KIE Server JMS Audit logger transacted
parameters.name: KIE_SERVER_JMS_AUDIT_TRANSACTED

parameters.description: User name for standard broker user. It is required for connecting to the broker. If left empty, it will be generated.
parameters.name: AMQ_USERNAME

parameters.description: Password for standard broker user. It is required for connecting to the broker. If left empty, it will be generated.
parameters.name: AMQ_PASSWORD

parameters.description: User role for standard broker user.
parameters.name: AMQ_ROLE

parameters.description: Queue names, separated by commas. These queues will be automatically created when the broker starts. Also, they will be made accessible as JNDI resources in EAP. These are the default queues needed by KIE Server. If using custom Queues, use the same values here as in the KIE_SERVER_JMS_QUEUE_RESPONSE, KIE_SERVER_JMS_QUEUE_REQUEST, KIE_SERVER_JMS_QUEUE_SIGNAL, KIE_SERVER_JMS_QUEUE_AUDIT  and KIE_SERVER_JMS_QUEUE_EXECUTOR parameters.
parameters.name: AMQ_QUEUES

parameters.description: Specifies the maximum amount of memory that message data can consume. If no value is specified, half of the system’s memory is allocated.
parameters.name: AMQ_GLOBAL_MAX_SIZE

parameters.description: The name of a secret containing AMQ SSL related files.
parameters.name: AMQ_SECRET

parameters.description: The name of the AMQ SSL Trust Store file.
parameters.name: AMQ_TRUSTSTORE

parameters.description: The password for the AMQ Trust Store.
parameters.name: AMQ_TRUSTSTORE_PASSWORD

parameters.description: The name of the AMQ keystore file.
parameters.name: AMQ_KEYSTORE

parameters.description: The password for the AMQ keystore and certificate.
parameters.name: AMQ_KEYSTORE_PASSWORD

parameters.description: Broker protocols to configure, separated by commas. Allowed values are: `openwire`, `amqp`, `stomp` and `mqtt`. Only `openwire` is supported by EAP.
parameters.name: AMQ_PROTOCOL

parameters.description: AMQ Broker Image
parameters.name: AMQ_BROKER_IMAGESTREAM_NAME

parameters.description: Namespace in which the ImageStreams for Red Hat AMQ images are installed. These ImageStreams are normally installed in the openshift namespace. You should only need to modify this if you installed the ImageStreams in a different namespace/project.
parameters.name: AMQ_IMAGE_STREAM_NAMESPACE

parameters.description: RH-SSO URL
parameters.name: SSO_URL

parameters.description: RH-SSO Realm name
parameters.name: SSO_REALM

parameters.description: KIE Server RH-SSO Client name
parameters.name: KIE_SERVER_SSO_CLIENT

parameters.description: KIE Server RH-SSO Client Secret
parameters.name: KIE_SERVER_SSO_SECRET

parameters.description: RH-SSO Realm Admin Username used to create the Client if it doesn't exist
parameters.name: SSO_USERNAME

parameters.description: RH-SSO Realm Admin Password used to create the Client
parameters.name: SSO_PASSWORD

parameters.description: RH-SSO Disable SSL Certificate Validation
parameters.name: SSO_DISABLE_SSL_CERTIFICATE_VALIDATION

parameters.description: RH-SSO Principal Attribute to use as username.
parameters.name: SSO_PRINCIPAL_ATTRIBUTE

parameters.description: LDAP Endpoint to connect for authentication
parameters.name: AUTH_LDAP_URL

parameters.description: Bind DN used for authentication
parameters.name: AUTH_LDAP_BIND_DN

parameters.description: LDAP Credentials used for authentication
parameters.name: AUTH_LDAP_BIND_CREDENTIAL

parameters.description: The JMX ObjectName of the JaasSecurityDomain used to decrypt the password.
parameters.name: AUTH_LDAP_JAAS_SECURITY_DOMAIN

parameters.description: LDAP Base DN of the top-level context to begin the user search.
parameters.name: AUTH_LDAP_BASE_CTX_DN

parameters.description: LDAP search filter used to locate the context of the user to authenticate. The input username or userDN obtained from the login module callback is substituted into the filter anywhere a {0} expression is used. A common example for the search filter is (uid={0}).
parameters.name: AUTH_LDAP_BASE_FILTER

parameters.description: The search scope to use.
parameters.name: AUTH_LDAP_SEARCH_SCOPE

parameters.description: The timeout in milliseconds for user or role searches.
parameters.name: AUTH_LDAP_SEARCH_TIME_LIMIT

parameters.description: The name of the attribute in the user entry that contains the DN of the user. This may be necessary if the DN of the user itself contains special characters, backslash for example, that prevent correct user mapping. If the attribute does not exist, the entry’s DN is used.
parameters.name: AUTH_LDAP_DISTINGUISHED_NAME_ATTRIBUTE

parameters.description: A flag indicating if the DN is to be parsed for the username. If set to true, the DN is parsed for the username. If set to false the DN is not parsed for the username. This option is used together with usernameBeginString and usernameEndString.
parameters.name: AUTH_LDAP_PARSE_USERNAME

parameters.description: Defines the String which is to be removed from the start of the DN to reveal the username. This option is used together with usernameEndString and only taken into account if parseUsername is set to true.
parameters.name: AUTH_LDAP_USERNAME_BEGIN_STRING

parameters.description: Defines the String which is to be removed from the end of the DN to reveal the username. This option is used together with usernameEndString and only taken into account if parseUsername is set to true.
parameters.name: AUTH_LDAP_USERNAME_END_STRING

parameters.description: Name of the attribute containing the user roles.
parameters.name: AUTH_LDAP_ROLE_ATTRIBUTE_ID

parameters.description: The fixed DN of the context to search for user roles. This is not the DN where the actual roles are, but the DN where the objects containing the user roles are. For example, in a Microsoft Active Directory server, this is the DN where the user account is.
parameters.name: AUTH_LDAP_ROLES_CTX_DN

parameters.description: A search filter used to locate the roles associated with the authenticated user. The input username or userDN obtained from the login module callback is substituted into the filter anywhere a {0} expression is used. The authenticated userDN is substituted into the filter anywhere a {1} is used. An example search filter that matches on the input username is (member={0}). An alternative that matches on the authenticated userDN is (member={1}).
parameters.name: AUTH_LDAP_ROLE_FILTER

parameters.description: The number of levels of recursion the role search will go below a matching context. Disable recursion by setting this to 0.
parameters.name: AUTH_LDAP_ROLE_RECURSION

parameters.description: A role included for all authenticated users
parameters.name: AUTH_LDAP_DEFAULT_ROLE

parameters.description: Name of the attribute within the roleCtxDN context which contains the role name. If the roleAttributeIsDN property is set to true, this property is used to find the role object’s name attribute.
parameters.name: AUTH_LDAP_ROLE_NAME_ATTRIBUTE_ID

parameters.description: A flag indicating if the DN returned by a query contains the roleNameAttributeID. If set to true, the DN is checked for the roleNameAttributeID. If set to false, the DN is not checked for the roleNameAttributeID. This flag can improve the performance of LDAP queries.
parameters.name: AUTH_LDAP_PARSE_ROLE_NAME_FROM_DN

parameters.description: Whether or not the roleAttributeID contains the fully-qualified DN of a role object. If false, the role name is taken from the value of the roleNameAttributeId attribute of the context name. Certain directory schemas, such as Microsoft Active Directory, require this attribute to be set to true.
parameters.displayName: LDAP Role Attribute ID is DN
parameters.name: AUTH_LDAP_ROLE_ATTRIBUTE_IS_DN

parameters.description: If you are not using referrals, you can ignore this option. When using referrals, this option denotes the attribute name which contains users defined for a certain role, for example member, if the role object is inside the referral. Users are checked against the content of this attribute name. If this option is not set, the check will always fail, so role objects cannot be stored in a referral tree.
parameters.name: AUTH_LDAP_REFERRAL_USER_ATTRIBUTE_ID_TO_CHECK

parameters.description: When present, the RoleMapping Login Module will be configured to use the provided file. This property defines the fully-qualified file path and name of a properties file or resource which maps roles to replacement roles. The format is original_role=role1,role2,role3
parameters.name: AUTH_ROLE_MAPPER_ROLES_PROPERTIES

parameters.description: Whether to add to the current roles, or replace the current roles with the mapped ones. Replaces if set to true.
parameters.name: AUTH_ROLE_MAPPER_REPLACE_ROLE
